alert.note: Alert for McDowell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 11:22AM EST until December 27 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following counties, Burke and McDowell. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas all across the upper Catawba Basin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1118 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated pockets of heavy rain continuing to overspread the advised area adding to the already received 2 to 4 inch rain and locally higher amounts. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Morganton, Marion, Salem, Glen Alpine, Old Fort, Lake James, Lake James State Park, South Mountains State Park, Nebo, Glenwood, Fero, Pleasant Gardens, Woodlawn, Dysartsville, Sugar Hill, North Cove, Thermal City and Ashford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
